column4: how come vlc 1.06 has bugs, but it is still the latest version of vlc available in the supposd LTS ubuntu 10.04?
which one do I keep? which do I remove? how do I remove? :)
I really don't know how to solve the issue I'm having.
do I lag really badly or did you miss my really long message before?
i missed it. i will scroll up
update the system first. reboot. then install nvidia and reboot

and if I haven't done that already, any way to rescue? it seems that from the GRUB screen, if I choose the server kernel, it gives me the same error and if I choose the generic kernel, it loads up fine.
sorry for bugging you, just not sure if you saw my last response.

and if I haven't done that already, any way to rescue? it seems that from the GRUB screen, if I choose the server kernel, it gives me the same error and if I choose the generic kernel, it loads up fine.
why are you choosing server kernel? are you on a desktop system
I don't know how it got installed. so I should remove the server kernel and it should boot up fine?
you could try remove that kernel, yes. but have a regular ubuntu iso cd or usb stick ready to reinstall if necessary
I have it since I reinstalled just last night. I'm trying to figure out how to remove the server kernel. I found the generic kernels in the Synaptic but can't seem to find the server ones.
